content.verbatim_text: In those procurement contracts where we agree that also the affiliates of Zebracorp have the right to place purchase order under the terms of the contract, we should specifically mention that those affiliates will place such orders ‘in their own name and for their own account’. The signing Zebracorp entity should not guarantee the payment or other obligations of other Zebracorp affiliates. Any such guarantee would require Zebracorp F&C’s express approval as such guarantee would need to be reported in Zebracorp financial accounts. Payment or other performance guarantees in favour of any unaffiliated third parties such as our contract manufacturers should not be accepted under any circumstances.
content.plain_text: If Zebracorp affiliates can place purchase orders under a contract, it must be specified that they do so 'in their own name and for their own account'. The signing Zebracorp entity must not guarantee the payment or obligations of other Zebracorp affiliates without express F&C approval (due to financial reporting). Guarantees for unaffiliated third parties are strictly prohibited.
content.expert_insight: This is a critical financial and legal control point. It ensures proper legal entity separation and prevents the primary contracting entity from incurring unforeseen liabilities for other group entities or external parties without explicit authorization and proper accounting treatment.
content.conditions: Procurement contracts allowing Zebracorp affiliates to place purchase orders.
content.justification: To prevent the signing Zebracorp entity from guaranteeing obligations of affiliates without proper approval and financial reporting, and to avoid guaranteeing unaffiliated third parties due to significant financial risk.
content.implication_company: Protects the signing entity from unintended financial liabilities, ensures compliance with financial reporting standards, and maintains clear corporate governance.
content.implication_supplier: Must understand which specific legal entity is responsible for payment and performance when affiliates place orders, and that guarantees from the signing entity are generally not provided.
content.source_insight: Internal Zebracorp financial and legal policy.
content.text: In those procurement contracts where we agree that also the affiliates of Zebracorp have the right to place purchase order under the terms of the contract, we should specifically mention that those affiliates will place such orders ‘in their own name and for their own account’. The signing Zebracorp entity should not guarantee the payment or other obligations of other Zebracorp affiliates. Any such guarantee would require Zebracorp F&C’s express approval as such guarantee would need to be reported in Zebracorp financial accounts. Payment or other performance guarantees in favour of any unaffiliated third parties such as our contract manufacturers should not be accepted under any circumstances.

content.verbatim_text: It is also important to ensure that Zebracorp does not make any express or implicit purchase commitments in the frame agreement. As a rule purchase commitments should be made through the issuance of purchase orders only once the frame agreement has been signed. Any purchase commitments in the frame agreement itself must be specifically approved internally in accordance with the F&C spend limits. Whenever Zebracorp does commit to issue purchase orders in purchase agreement, then it recommended to include the provisions stating that: Zebracorp is relieved from all liability in cases where failure to consume the products is caused by reasons attributable the supplier (in e.g. the supplier having quality or delivery issues, or otherwise being in breach of default); Supplier must request Zebracorp to honour its purchase commitment within a certain time frame, failing which Zebracorp is released from its purchase commitment and the supplier foregoes its right to claim any compensation; and Zebracorp’s purchase commitment has an overall maximum ceiling, which can be expressed in e.g. as a fixed dollar amount.
content.plain_text: Zebracorp must avoid express or implicit purchase commitments within frame agreements; commitments should generally be made via purchase orders after the frame agreement is signed. Any commitments made directly in a frame agreement require specific internal F&C approval based on spend limits. If Zebracorp commits to issuing purchase orders in a purchase agreement, it is recommended to include clauses that: relieve Zebracorp of liability if non-consumption is due to supplier fault; require the supplier to claim the commitment within a specified timeframe, otherwise Zebracorp is released; and establish a maximum ceiling for Zebracorp’s purchase commitment (e.g., a fixed dollar amount).
content.expert_insight: This comprehensive guideline is vital for controlling financial exposure and preventing open-ended liabilities in procurement. It mandates strict internal approval for any commitments made outside the standard PO process and provides essential contractual safeguards when such commitments are unavoidable.
content.conditions: Making purchase commitments in frame agreements or purchase agreements.
content.justification: To control financial exposure, ensure commitments align with internal spend limits, and mitigate risks associated with non-consumption or supplier default.
content.implication_company: Protects Zebracorp from excessive or unintended financial liabilities, ensures proper authorization for commitments, and provides legal defenses against supplier claims.
content.implication_supplier: Must understand that commitments are primarily made via POs, and any commitments within frame agreements are subject to strict conditions, limitations, and potential forfeiture if not claimed timely.
content.source_insight: Internal Zebracorp financial and legal policy.
